edu.rit.pj2.vbl

Class BitSetVbl.Union

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.util.BitSet
      • edu.rit.pj2.vbl.BitSetVbl
        • edu.rit.pj2.vbl.BitSetVbl.Union
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable, Vbl, Cloneable
    Enclosing class:
    BitSetVbl

    public static class BitSetVbl.Union
extends BitSetVbl
    Class BitSetVbl.Union provides a reduction variable for a set of integers from 0 to a given upper bound, where the reduction operation is set union. The set elements are stored in a bitmap representation. The largest integer that can be stored is N−1, where N is specified as a constructor argument.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • BitSetVbl.Union

        public BitSetVbl.Union()
        Construct a new uninitialized set. This constructor is for use only by object streaming.

      • BitSetVbl.Union

        public BitSetVbl.Union(int max)
        Construct a new empty set. The set can hold elements from 0 through N−1 inclusive, where N is the smallest multiple of 32 greater than or equal to max.
        Parameters:
        max - Maximum number of elements (≥ 1).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if max < 1.

      • BitSetVbl.Union

        public BitSetVbl.Union(BitSet set)
        Construct a new set that is a copy of the given set.
        Parameters:
        set - Set to copy.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if set is null.

        public BitSetVbl.Union add(int elem)

      • add

        public BitSetVbl.Union add(int lb,
                  int ub)
        Add all elements in the given range to this set. All elements from lb through ub−1, inclusive, are added to this set. If any element is not in the range 0 .. N−1, that element is not added. If lb ≥ ub, this set is unchanged.
        Overrides:
        add in class BitSetVbl
        Parameters:
        lb - Lower bound element (inclusive).
        ub - Upper bound element (exclusive).
        Returns:
        This set.

      • remove

        public BitSetVbl.Union remove(int lb,
                     int ub)
        Remove all elements in the given range from this set. All elements from lb through ub−1, inclusive, are removed from this set. If any element is not in the range 0 .. N−1, that element is not removed. If lb ≥ ub, this set is unchanged.
        Overrides:
        remove in class BitSetVbl
        Parameters:

        ub - Upper bound element (exclusive).
        Returns:

      • flip

        public BitSetVbl.Union flip(int elem)
        Flip the given element. If this set contains elem, it is removed; if this set does not contain elem, it is added. If elem is not in the range 0 .. N−1, this set is unchanged.
        Overrides:
        flip in class BitSetVbl
        Parameters:
        elem - Element.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • flip

        public BitSetVbl.Union flip(int lb,
                   int ub)
        Flip all elements in the given range. All elements from lb through ub−1, inclusive, are flipped. If this set contains such an element, it is removed; if this set does not contain such an element, it is added. If any element is not in the range 0 .. N−1, that element is not flipped. If lb ≥ ub, this set is unchanged.
        Overrides:
        flip in class BitSetVbl
        Parameters:
        lb - Lower bound element (inclusive).
        ub - Upper bound element (exclusive).
        Returns:
        This set.

      • union

        public BitSetVbl.Union union(BitSet set)
        Change this set to be the union of itself and the given set. The union consists of all elements that appear in this set or the given set or both.
        Overrides:
        union in class BitSetVbl
        Parameters:
        set - Set.
        Returns:
        This set.

        public BitSetVbl.Union difference(BitSet set)

        Overrides:

      • symmetricDifference

        public BitSetVbl.Union symmetricDifference(BitSet set)
        Change this set to be the symmetric difference of itself and the given set. The symmetric difference consists of all elements that appear in this set or the given set, but not both.
        Overrides:

      • reduce

        public void reduce(Vbl vbl)
        Reduce the given shared variable into this shared variable. The two variables are combined together, and the result is stored in this shared variable. The reduce() method does not need to be multiple thread safe (thread synchronization is handled by the caller).

        The BitSetVbl.Union class's reduce() method changes this set to the union of this set and the given set.

        Specified by:
        reduce in interface Vbl
        Overrides:
        reduce in class BitSetVbl
        Parameters:
        vbl - Shared variable.
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the class of vbl is not compatible with the class of this shared variable.
